properties.name: (Claude Colliot) Le Bamboche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 15, rue de Babylone, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 49 14 40 Metro: Sevres-Babylone http://www.lebamboche.com/

properties.name: 1800 Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Reservations: +30 22860 71485 - Reservations required Located in the town of Oia on Santorini in the Cyclades Islands in Greece, this Slow Food restaurant is located in a beautful 19th Century mansion, formerly a captain’s house. Ia is walking only city, but the restaurant is easy to find on the north side of the main walkway on the way to the tip of the peninsula. 1800 focuses on a very complete single seating evening meal serving creative Mediterranean cuisine using local Santorini products. Pricey, but there are not many Slow Food restaurants in the islands, so make sure to give it a try for a special evening. Most importantly, don\'t forget to watch the sunset in Ia first over the Caldera, and don\'t forget those reservations! "At the “1800” Oia Restaurant in Santorini, not only are you offered an enjoyable meal, but also the chance to get acquainted with the local culture of Santorini. The aim of the owner and his colleagues is to familiarize its guests with the customs and traditions of Santorini and the Aegean Area in general." - "1800" "At the northern tip of the crescent, the village of Oia frosts the land with a cluster of white houses, many built by wealthy ship-owners in the nineteenth century. One of the most spectacular homes had been abandoned for more than three decades when architect Ioannis Zaggelidis began restoring it in 1986. He called it RESTAURANT 1800. The menu focuses on traditional Greek dishes, including roasted fish and a mezedes platter with local cheeses. Grilled lamb chops, a Greek classic, are served with an original touch: a sweet-and-sour green applesauce. All are enhanced by the view from the rooftop garden, the perfect spot for a certain wealthy ship-owner to be there in spirit." - Bon Appetit (May 2002)

properties.name: 21 rue Mazarine
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 21 rue Mazarine, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 46 33 76 90 Metro: Saint-Germain-des Pres, Mabillon or Odeon

properties.name: 21st Amendment
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 563 2nd St, San Francisco, CAReservations not typically needed except gamedays, available by phone at (415) 369-0900. Easy to eat at the bar. Pure local brew! Looking to get away from Gordon Biersch or Anchor Steam, this is your place. You\'ll find me here on weeknights, also a great place to go before the game. Outdoor beer garden during gamedays. If you love IPA, you\'ll love 21st. Also try their Watermelon Wheat if it\'s summer, a great light summer beer. The food is also excellent, can\'t go wrong here.

properties.name: 35 Degres Ouest
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 35 rue de Verneuil, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 42 86 98 88 Metro: Musee d\'Orsay

properties.name: A 16
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2355 Chestnut Street, San Francisco, CaliforniaReservations (OpenTable.com) Recognized as possibly the best Italian restaurant in the country, and I absolutely can\'t disagree. Make sure you go as a very small crowd, it\'s very difficult to get the same experience with a large party. Surprisingly inexpensive for the quality, and an absolutely stunning Italian wine list...make sure to try the Lambrusco if they have it, it has finally matured as a sparkling red wine of quality and is delightful. My last visit really was exquisite, their salumi that is locally dry aged is fantastic, as is their prosciutto selection. If you\'ve never experienced Burrata cream filled Mozarella, you\'re in for a particular treat. Also a fantastic Bergamont Orange sorbet (think Earl Grey tea) for dessert that was astonishing in flavor and creativity. You simply won\'t find boring Italian food, simply put you will have the finest flavor balancing and perfectly cooked meats, homemade pizzas and pastas as well.

properties.name: Alcatraz
properties.description: Posted by FinksterTourists welcome....you have to visit The Rock at least once in your lifetime. See website above for ferry info.

properties.name: Angel Island
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Angel Island was the Ellis Island of the west, but also played its part in one of our nation\'s uglier moments while implementing the Chinese Exclusion Act of 1882, becoming the location where racial profiling was used as part of interrogation techniques at the immigration station. During WWII, it was also used as a US Army POW processing center. ngel Island is one of the most picturesque places in the bay, giving panoramic views of the city skyline and the bridges. A wonderful all day excursion with a stop over in Tiburon for drinks or lunch. You can bring your bikes on the ferry if you like. It\'s a about a 2 hour walk around the island. Ferry info is in the web link above.

properties.name: Antiche Sere Osteria
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Via Cenischia, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 3854347 Reservations: Make sure to call ahead, only one seating per night Closed Domenica 30 minute walk from Puorto Nuovo, an amazing gem of a family run Slow Food restaurant featuring 3 generations in kitchen and waiting tables. We had veal tibbia, an amazing rabbit with marmalade, veal carppacio, fresh cheese, tagliettele with asparagus, incredible panna cotta and strawberry zabagione.

properties.name: Aqua
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 252 California St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) High end contemporary seafood, very romantic ambience. Pricey, but a must try in the City.

properties.name: Aranysarkany Vendeglo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster H-2000 Szentendre, Alkotmany u. 1/a, HungaryAnother easter egg! This very small Hungarian restaurant is easily missed walking through the pedestrian district i Szentendre 20 minutes out of Budapest, but it is definitely a must not miss. Walking in, the aroma of herbs set out on the table adjusts you to the home style kitchen and amazing local food you will find here. Don\'t forget to order a bottle of drier Tokaj wine, it\'ll go well with anything on the menu. Absolutely in my top restaurants list worldwide.

properties.name: Art Hotel Boston
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  70, Via Massena, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 500359 Wonderful boutique hotel with unique rooms, very clean and modern, and a very good value for the money. Highly recommended.

properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Another great beach with classic views of the Golden Gate...this is where the old B&W picture of the bridge under construction was taken from. Worth a view and a drive through the Presidio which is now a National Park.

properties.name: Bourbon & Branch
properties.description: Posted by Finkster501 Jones St, San Francisco, CAPrivate 1920s speakeasy...not even so much a sign on the door. You think they don\'t want onlookers....you\'re right, so make sure to make a reservation on their website. One of the cooler high end cocktail experiences in they city, you\'ll find hundreds of drinks you\'ve never tried but should. Specializing in high end ingredients and rare bottles, this place makes perfectly mixed drinks to match the impeccable 20\'s decor.

properties.name: Brick
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1085 Sutter St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Bubble Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster714 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) This is the place to start or end a classy evening...dimly lit romantic room where you can get bubbles, strawberries and chocolate! Best to reserve (yes even for drinks) in order to get a couch area to relax and drink your very expensive champagne cocktails.

properties.name: Buena Vista Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2765 Hyde St, San Francisco, CAHistoric cafe with great views of the bay...where the Irish Coffee was invented. While touristy, right off of Ghirardelli square, you have to try at least one Irish Coffee.

properties.name: Burma Super Star
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 309 Clement St, San Francisco, CANO Reservations Amazing Burmese food...no surprise with the name, and inexpensive. Very difficult to get into, so plan ahead for a line or get there early!

properties.name: Cable Car Terminus
properties.description: Posted by FinksterCatch the cable car at Powell & Market St, or better yet, jump on mid-way...don\'t forget to stand on the running boards and hang off the side! Make sure to buy a ticket first. There are several cable car lines, but this line goes all the way to Ghiradelli Square near Marina Green. It\'s a fun and inexpensive way to get across the City.

properties.name: Cafe Gibraltar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  425 Avenue Alhambra, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations: None for parties of 4 or less...but you can call (650) 560-9039 on the day of to get on the list. Simply one of the finest restaurants in the Bay Area, in tiny little Half Moon Bay near the Princeton Harbor. Serving Mediterranean food, this is home cooking at its finest. You have to try this place at least once, it\'s worth the drive.

properties.name: Cafe Intermezzo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  2442 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CACafe Intermezzo (510) 849-4592

properties.name: Cafe Savoy
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Vítězná 5, Praha 5 Beer: Staropramen on tap Beautiful decor recently restored, excellent fare all day and night, from the obligatory Goulash to excellent Schnitzel and french inspired food. You can\'t beat the quality for the price in Prague. Also excellent wine selection of Czech and eastern wines.

properties.name: Cafe for All Seasons
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  150 West Portal, San Francisco, CAReservations: None needed for breakfast, but expect a wait if you come in late. Dinner reservations by calling (415) 665-0900 Excellent neighorhood breakfast cafe, wonderful california style breakfast. Also serves an excellent dinner. One of the Chronicle Bay Area top 100 regularly. Try their Fried Polenta with pepper apple smoked Bacon, also their salads are excellent.

properties.name: California Academy of Science and Steinhart Aquarium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 875 Howard St, San Francisco, CA, 94103The academy includes the excellent Steinhart aquarium, reptilian exhibits, excellent kids discovery experiences and a natural history exhibit. Note that the academy is temporarily located at this facility while the Golden Gate Park facility is being renovated.

properties.description: Posted by Finkster 845 Main St, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Newer "super restaurant" serving wonderul Mediterranean cuisine, certainly one of the top Med restaurants in the Bay Area. Also a lovely bar area with Jazz music regularly, eating off the bar menu and tuning out is just great here. Started by the chef of Rose Pistola.

properties.name: Cha Cha Cha
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2327 Mission St, San Francisco, CAReservations: Phone only (415) 648-0504 What can I say? Patatas Bravas...Sangria....Mojitos...Yum. No better place for drinks on a weekend and some Tapas.

properties.name: Chaise Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster309 Cortland Ave, San Francisco, CAReview Wednesday - ladies Friday - straight crowd Every other night you never know what you\'re gonna get! Metrosexual feel, with high end drinks

properties.name: Chapeau
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1408 Clement St., San Francisco, CA, United States

properties.name: Chateau du Sureau
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 48688 Victoria Lane, Oakhurst, CA 93644Simply the finest lodging near Yosemite, don\'t settle for the Ahwahnee if you can afford the Chateau, it is unfortunately a once in a life experience for most due to the ~00/night price tag. Newly built so it has all the great amenities and a lovely grounds with a full day spa, but with all the old Europe charm. Lovely large rooms each with a fireplace and most with four-poster beds. Simply wonderful service, wine and snacks are included in the price and available anytime you ask, and an excellent breakfast each morning. The Chateau staff also will create lunch\'s to go for park excursions, providing you with a cooler full of food and water. Don\'t miss this gem if you\'re looking for a romantic weekend near yosemite. About a 45 minute drive into the park depending on the time of year. Don\'t forget to go to Erna\'s Elderberry House restaurant which is connected to the Chateau for a phenomenal, but expensive dining experience.

properties.name: Chaya Brasserie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 132 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com)

properties.name: Chez Georges
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1, rue du Mail, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 42 60 07 11 Metro: Sentier

properties.name: Chez L'Ami Jean
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 27 rue Malar, 75007 Paris, FranceReservations: +33 01 47 05 86 89 required for both lunch and dinner Metro: Invalides Opened by a Basque nationalist in 1931, this tiny bistro has quietly emerged as one of the finest restaurants in Paris. I make sure to pay a visit every time I\'m in Paris, as the menu changes frequently, and it\'s not often you can get a taste of high end Basque influenced cuisine. My favorites include many of their daily soups which are served with toasted croutons tossed with vegetables and bacon, absolutely wonderful. Of course their menu changes regularly, but they typically offer amazing game (veal, venison), various poultry (pigeon, squab) and foie gras options as well. Typically very herbal flavors infused and paired with equisitely prepared vegetables. Also don\'t forget to try their desserts, they are truly special.

While the charm is wonderful, the food is a bit average. However, you won\'t be dissapointed with the wine bar.

Circa turns into a happening bar/lounge after 10 or so, keep your table until late in the evening to have a place to sit and hold court. Good small plates: Poached shrimp, sliders, mac and cheese, fat-iron steak.

Make sure to stop in while visiting the de Young or the Japanese Tea Garden.

properties.description: Posted by Finkster216 Townsend, San Francisco, CAYet another new SOMA Wine Lounge, serving great small plates and dinner food. More lounge with couches and curtains than restaurant, translates into to great after work SOMA crowd Wed-Fri.

properties.name: Dolores Park
properties.description: Posted by FinksterDolores St and 19th St, San Francisco, CAIn the height of the Mission, one of the storied views from San Francisco that you\'ll remember from many movies.

properties.name: Ebisu
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1283 9th Ave, San Francisco, CA, 94122NO Reservations - walk in waitlist only Best Sushi in the City...hands down. Nothing more to say, simply the freshest fish and the best Sushi chefs. Definitely sit at the bar, and don\'t be afraid to provide beer to the chefs!

properties.name: Eiji
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 317 Sanchez St, San Francisco, CAReservations: (415) 558-8149 Restaurant focusing on Tofu dishes and classical sushi.

properties.name: El Rio
properties.description: Posted by Finkster3158 Mission Street, San Francisco CAReview A "gray" bar in The City. Happy hour, low priced drinks, barbecue parties, open-air theaters, Sunday salsa night...and oh yeah, free oysters.

properties.name: Erna's Elderberry House
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 48688 Victoria Lane, Oakhurst, CA 93644Phone: (559) 683-6800 Simply put Erna\'s is the only high quality dining experience near or in Yosemite...however the price is very elevated as it is up in the remote reaches and is truly in a class of its own. Expect to spend 0/person for the menu and 0 for a 3 or 0 for a 6 wine flight per person. As a pure prix fixe menu, Erna\'s provides a unique menu each evening offering up to 6 courses to choose from. Erna\'s is connected to it\'s sister establishment Chateau du Sureau, which is simply one of the finest upscale bed and breakfasts in California, far outclassing it\'s local "in Yosemite park" competition at the Ahwahnee Lodge which is highly overrated IMO. Anyone staying at the hotel automatically gets reservations each evening (you don\'t have to use them). Otherwise you must call for reservations. The wine is a bit pricey considered it is mostly locally grown and normally inexpensive, but you will get good pairings, and certainly wines from the central valley you will not have tried before. Loved the Westbrook wine farm Viognier-Valdiguie Madera 2005, and the St. Amant Tempranillo Amador 2004. A few tips on the food, I prefer picking a smaller menu of their better preparations as their appetizer, salad and desserts are not at all inspiring. So here\'s what I did....the amuse is always creative, their soup chef is a genius and is always simply phenomenal, and their meats are so incredibly juicy and tender. Some menus I had when I went there: #1: * Amuse: Crispy veal sweet breads with caraway and water chestnuts in goulash sauce * Pan seared sea bass fillet and red cabbage risotto with baby carrots, bok choy and pecorino romano in a bleeding heart radish broth * Roasted parsnip soup with goose dumpling and chive crepes * Herb crusted rack of lamb, lentils, boudin noir and puntarelle, rosewater glazed asparagus, juniper lamb jus * Salad of young field greens, marinated Belgian endive and artichokes, savory-black pepper vinaigrette * Dark chocolate mousse cake and toasted pecan creme caramel #2: * Amuse: Venison pate, lingonberry coulis, spiced pecans * Acorn squash soup, smoked potato beignet, white truffle foam * Sliced pork tenderloin, glazed mustard spatzle, braised baby leeks and red cabbage, fennel seed-pork jus

properties.name: Espace Dégustation Legrand
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1, rue de la Banque, Paris 75002Tel: +33 01 42 60 07 12 Metro: Pyramides Patricia wells recommended wine bar...

properties.name: Exploratorium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3601 Lyon Street, San Francisco, CAWonderfully creative science museum for kids and adults. An absolute must if you bring kids to the city.

properties.name: Farley's
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1315 18th Street, San Francisco, CAYou have to love the built-in pretentiousness of a place that will only serve one size of coffee, and only use whole milk.

properties.name: Farmer Brown
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 25 Mason St, San Francisco, CAChronicle review Phone: (415) 409-3276 Hearty soul food in the bustling downtown financial district...very hip atmosphere.

properties.name: Ferry Building Marketplace
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  Best culinary experience in the city. Beautiful restored ferry building, now exclusively high end foods and shopping. Saturday morning Farmer\'s Market is a must for local foods. Favorites include: * Cowgirl Creamery - best cheese on the West Coast * Wine Bar * Far West Funghi - buy the Truffle Salt and put it on popcorn * The Slanted Door - Fusion Vietnamese restaurant, one of the best places in the city. Great Belgian beer and Riesling selection. * Ciao Bella - Gelato * Della Fattoria - Italian wood oven baked breads * ....and so much more!

properties.name: Firefly
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4288 24th St, san francisco, caWarm and inviting, with a young lived in atmosphere in Noe Valley. Excellent southern flavor cuisine, you\'re bound to find black eyed peas and greens in some of the dishes, but also with a fusion flare. Also had a quite interesting crispy risotto cakes filled with goat cheese.

properties.name: Fish La Boissonnerie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 69, rue du Seine, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 54 34 69 Metro: Saint-Germain-des Pres, or Mabillon, or Odeon

properties.description: Posted by Finkster 762 Divisadero, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Foreign Cinema
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  2534 Mission St, San Francisco, CA, 94110Reservations (OpenTable.com) Very good ambience...all concrete building inside of an old theater space. On the outside patio, black and white foreign films are projected on the wall. Great california fusion cuisine. Don\'t forget to stop in the adjoining bar outside, Laszlo\'s Bar, it\'s a Russian Communist style bar, and they serve great cocktails.

properties.name: Frisson
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 244 Jackson St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Elegant contemporary dining, French and American cuisine. I have to say they had some of the most innovative flavor blends, wonderful starters, and in particular very interesting sorbets for dessert.

properties.name: Gator's Neo-Soul Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  129 S B St, San Mateo, CA

properties.name: Ghirardelli Chocolates @ Ghirardelli Square
properties.description: Posted by Finkster900 N Point St, San Francisco, CAThe original Ghirardelli location...where to get your fab chocolate souvenirs before you go home. But really, they have a great ice cream sundae store run by Ghirardelli that is great on a warm vacation day.

properties.name: Greens

properties.name: Guaymas
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 5 Main St, Tiburon, CAReservations by phone only at (415) 435-6300 Authentic Mexican food with a beatiful on the bay location right at the Tiburon Ferry dock...great margaritas and Tomalitos. Make sure to visit Sam\'s for drinks next door as well on a sunny day and sit out on the deck. A great weekend destination on the way to Angel Island as well.

properties.name: Harigara Japanese Tea Garden
properties.description: Posted by Finkster   Thought the fortune cookie was chinese? In fact it\'s an American invention, created at the Japanese Tea Garden as a special snack for the World Exposition in celebration of the rebuilding of the city after the 1906 earthquake devastation. The Tea Garden is a beautifully maintained and peaceful place in the middle of Golden Gate Park. Take a calming stroll, and share some tea in the tea house.

properties.name: Hidden Vine
properties.description: Posted by Finkster620 Post St, San Francisco, CAWine and cheese, cozy and seductive. Entrance is on Cosmo Place off of Taylor. SF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Hotel Biron Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 45 Rose St, San Francisco, CADark and sexy vibe at this winebar. Small plates, olives and cheese available. SF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Hotel Centauro
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Campo Manin 4297, Venezia, ItalyTel: +39 041 5225832 Central to most of Venice and right on the canals, a beautiful boutique hotel with rich fabric covered comforting rooms, very well furnished.

properties.name: Hotel Isa
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 39, Via Cicerone, Rome, ItalyTel: +39 06-3212610 Nearby the Vatican, a newly remodeled modern hotel, each room with unique styling.

properties.name: Izakaya Mai
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 212 2nd Ave., San Mateo, CA

properties.name: Jack Falstaff
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 598 2nd St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Urban cozy comfort food....soul food with a california cuisine twist. You\'ll love the leather on the walls and the clean design lines in the restaurant making a vibrant but relaxed atmosphere in a slow food tradition. Only local produce used, and used creatively. Close to the ballpark, this is a warm and comforting with very creative dishes.

properties.name: Jardiniere
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 300 Grove Street, San Francisco, CA, 94102Reservations (OpenTable.com) High end French cuisine for those of you needing a good Foie Gras fix. Great romantic dinner place.

properties.name: Jeanty at Jack's
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 615 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Charming atmosphere...sister restaurant to Bistro Jeanty in Yountville. Very affordable and romantic, yet still casual, a great option compared to pricier Jardiniere and Masa\'s. If you couldn\'t tell, I love French food!

properties.name: John Colins
properties.description: Posted by Finkster90 Natoma St, San Francisco, CASweet lounge action

properties.name: Kacsa Vendéglő
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1027 Budapest, Fő utca 75, HungaryAnd yet another easter egg. You\'ve got to be kidding me how amazing this place is, absolutely the best Duck preparations you will find in the world. Kacsa specializes in crispy duck but keeps it incredibly moist. Don\'t hold back with your meal, start with the Poire William, Caviar, ask for recommendations on the Hungarian red wines. And of course, don\'t forget the Tokaj dessert wine. Kacsa also offers the finest service I have ever seen, you will experience warm and friendly waiters, while still having everything served under silver domed plates and platters, and wine decanted under candle light. Strongly recommend paying in cash, they may have a special suprise for you if you do, but they also take credit cards.

properties.name: Kids Discovery Museum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  557 McReynolds Rd, Sausalito, CAHands on science and discovery museum at the foot of the Golden Gate bridge. Great location, and great for kids.

properties.name: Konzertcafe Schwarzenberg
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Karntnerring 17, 1010 Wien, AustriaPhone: +43 512.89.98 Absolutely my favorite traditional Viennese cafe and if you aren\'t familiar, Vienna is the best cafe culture in the world due to its elegance, desserts and food selection. This particular choice is arguably a close call to best in Vienna with the Sasher Cafe which created the Sasher Torte. Either way, located close to the Opera house in downtown Vienna, this beautiful high ceiling cafe has wonderful desserts, coffees (my favorite is the Fakir Coffee with the shot of Cherry Brandy) and good quality Viennese traditional food. Also a great place for Austrian beer and wine. This place is a class act and an easy place to just stop in to for a light snack or tea time.

properties.name: L'Agrifoglio Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 38, Via dell\'Accademia Albertina, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 837064 Reservations: Call ahead Closed Domenica A short 10 minute walk from Piazza Castello, this very private Slow Food restaurant requires a reservation and doesn\'t have a sign above the door....bottom line, call ahead! Fantastic veal ravioli, and of course for the cheese lovers, order the "cheese clock" comprised of 12 different artisan cheeses arranged at each station of the clock.

properties.name: L'Alsaco
properties.description: Posted by Finkster10, rue Condorcet, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 26 44 31 Metro: Gare du Nord

properties.name: L'Angle du Faubourg
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 195 rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 40 74 20 20 Metro: George V, Ternes or Courcelles

properties.name: L'Astrance
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4, Rue Beethoven, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 40 50 84 40 Metro: Passy

properties.name: L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4, rue de Montalembert, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 42 22 56 56 Metro: Rue du Bac

properties.name: L'Ecailler du Bistrot
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 22 rue Paul Bert, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 72 76 77 Metro: Faidherbe-Chaligny

properties.name: L'Oca Fola Trattoria
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 6, Via Drovetti, Torino, ItalyTel: 011 4337422 Closed Domenica Slow food eating guide recommendation.

properties.name: L'Os a Moelle
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3 rue vasco-de-gama, parisReservations: +33 01 45 57 27 27 Metro: Lourmel stop on #8 line Closed Sunday and Monday Very high quality neighborhood restaurant at an amazing price (30 Euro), serving only prix fixe menu of french cuisine. The menu is presented on a simple blackboard, offering 2 options for each of the six courses (the courses include a soup, entree, seafood, meat, cheese and dessert usually). Also, don\'t forget to try the Cave de l\'Os a Moelle across the street before or after your dinner...this neighborhood wine bar is a gem, serving family style serve yourself buffet style country food (foie gras terrine, pickles, preserved meats, lentil stew, etc.). You can eat a full meal casually if you like at the wine bar, but it\'s not the same food as the restaurant across the street. Their number is 01 45 57 28 28.

properties.name: La Cagouille
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 10 Place Brancusi, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 22 09 01 Restaurant Website: www.la-cagouille.fr.

properties.name: La Ciccia
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 291 30th St, San Francisco, CAReservations: 415.550.8114 So what the heck was I thinking having this on my \'places to try" list for so long? Seriously folks, this place absolutely gives A16 a run for its money as the best Italian in SF....but more importantly with a native Sardinian chef and family run business, the food specialization is like nothing else you\'ll find stateside. Discover this for yourself! The wine list is second to none, everything is amazing on the menu, and the desserts are fantastic. If there\'s one place on my Platial to go to, this is it, congratulations on finding my easter egg! :)

properties.name: La Fontaine de Mars
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 129 rue Saint Dominique, Paris 75007, FranceTel: +33 01 47 05 46 44 Reservations needed for dinner Metro: Ecole Militaire, or Pont de l\'Alma (RER) Excellent value for the money for classic French bistro food.

properties.name: Laszlo Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster2526 Mission St, San Francisco, CARussian Communist Bar....yes, you read it right...awesome place for a drink before going to Foreign Cinema next door, or Cha Cha Cha down the street. My favorite...try the Heat Seeker.

properties.name: Le Bistrot Paul Bert
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 18 rue Paul Bert, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 72 76 77 Metro: Faidherbe-Chaligny

properties.name: Le Cinq Mars
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 51, rue de Verneuil, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 44 69 13 Metro: Musee d\'Orsay

properties.name: Le Comptoir
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Carrefour de l\'Odeon, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 44 27 07 97 Metro: Odeon

properties.name: Le Dome
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 108, Boulevard du Montparnasse, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 35 25 81 Metro: Vavin

properties.name: Le Manoir
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4 petite rue St. Antoine, 06400 Cannes, FranceReservations: on website or by calling +33 04 93 38 35 49 Excellent contemporary french cuisine in Cannes, very lush interior on the side streets on the hillside in the walking district. Featuring a standard prix fixe menu du Manoir for 34E, and a Black truffle menu in the winter for 59E

properties.name: Le Petit Marguery
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9 boulevard du Port Royal, Paris, FranceTel: 01 43 31 58 59 Metro: Les Gobelins

properties.name: Le Severo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 8 rue des Plantes, Paris, Francetel: +33 01 45 40 40 91

properties.name: Le Soleil
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 109 Avenue Michelet, 93400 Saint Ouen, FranceTel: +33 01 40 10 08 08

properties.name: Le Timbre
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3 rue Sainte-Beuve, Paris 75006, FranceTel: +33 01 45 49 10 40 Metro: Notre-Dame-des-Champs, or Vavin

properties.name: Le Villaret
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 19 rue Ternaux, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 57 75 56 Metro: Parmentier

properties.name: Legion of Honor
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  100 34th Ave, San Francisco, CAThe Palace of the Legion of Honor and museum sits atop a hill at the end of the City, providing fantastic views of the Golden Gate Bridge. The museum houses special exhibitions and a lovely permanent collection in cluding European art, art on paper, and 18th century English and French porcelain.

properties.name: Les Allobroges
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 71 rue des Grands-Champs, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 43 73 40 00 Metro: Maraichers

properties.name: Les Bouquinistes
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 53, quai des grands augustins, paris franceReservations: +33 01 43 25 45 94 Location: on the Left bank 2 blocks off of Notre Dame & Ile St. Louis Metro: St. Michel (4), Odeon (4,10) On my regular restaurant list, I never fail to visit Bouquinistes as they have very inventive dishes from Chef Guy Savoy. Many of their dishes incorporate wonderful "frothy" light sauces, as well as extremely innovative soups and purees. Some favorites: * Cream of chestnut soup with wild mushrooms and a lyon sausage brioche. * Wild fowl and foie gras pate, cooked in a terrine with pears cooked in Sezchuan pepper and bitter lettuce salad * Royal dauarade lemon-thyme with wild mushrooms and sweet pumpkin .....and so much more, the menu changes regularly A bit on the pricey side, but the quality of the food is phenominal.

properties.name: Lilly's Bar B Que
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 705 Divisadero, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Lombard St (Curviest Street)
properties.description: Posted by FinksterYes, you have to do Lombard St at least once to see the curviest street in the world.

properties.name: Lush Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1092 Post St, San Francisco, CAReview Ex-Piano bar, turned Gray bar with old Hollywood feel...pics of old school crooners on the wall.

properties.name: Lvi Dvur
properties.description: Posted by Finkster U Prasneho Mostu 6, Prague 1 On the north side entrance to the castle (not the main entrance), sits Lvi Dvur, and absolutely amazing restaurant specializing in high end Czech cuisine with French influence. Suprisingly affordable for the quality, this is a must visit for foodies in an otherwise good but not great food town. Their specialty is the roasted pig, but everything I had on the menu was wonderful. For the beer freaks, they serve Kruscovice light and dark.

properties.name: Mai's Vietnamese Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 316 Clement St, San Francisco, CA(415) 221-3046

properties.name: Marin Headlands - Bridge View!
properties.description: Posted by FinksterOK, ever wonder where everyone takes those great bridge pictures, well you now have found it! A steep incline on the north side of the GG Bridge, the headlands provide an amazing view above the bridge...enjoy! I never get tired of this view.

properties.name: Marin Headlands - Fort Cronkite
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Beautiful day hike and picnic location on the ocean side. So close to San Francisco via the Golden Gate you\'d hardly believe you just left the City. Beautiful views towards the bridge and the ocean, classic Northern California rugged coastline.

properties.name: Masa's
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 648 bush street, san franciscoReservations (OpenTable.com) One of the most celebrated restaurants in the country, Masa\'s delivers the highest end French cuisine comparing with Chez Panisse and the French Laundry. Of course with quality...comes price! For special occasions and romantic moments, Masa\'s can\'t be beat.

properties.name: Metreon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  101 4th St # 500, San Francisco, CAThe Sony Metreon houses the largest theaters in the City, IMAX, Sony Store, game salon, and Gillians restaurant and pool hall. Next door to the Metreon is the Zeum Discovery Museum, Carousel ride, ice skating and bowling alley. Generally a great center for entertaining kids.

properties.name: Miss Pearl's Jam House
properties.description: Posted by Finkster601 Eddy St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Mon Vieil Ami
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 69 rue Saint Louis en l’Ile, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 61 09 46 Metro: Cite, or Pont Marie

properties.name: Monterey Bay Aquarium
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 866 Cannery Row, Monterey, CAThe Monterey Bay Aquarium is widely considered the finest aquarium in the world. The Outer Bay Aquarium featuring various sharks and tuna is simply stunning in its shear size and beauty...but only to be outdone by the jellyfish permanent exhibit which lets you get up closer than ever before to hundreds of beautiful jellys in the most serene environment. Great for kids and adults, this is a must visit if you are in the bay area for an extended period. Monterey is approximately 2.5 hours south of San Francisco.

properties.name: NOPA
properties.description: Posted by Finkster560 Divisadero Street, San Francisco, CA, United States

properties.name: Nectar Wine Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3330 Steiner St, San Francisco, CAUltra hip atmosphere wine bar off Chestnut...one of my favorite pure wine bar experiences where the focus is on wine and small food, not on being a restaurant. Very lush atmosphere and unique but comfortable seating makes it cozy but sexy. Good quality small plates with a fun and broad wine list. Try the pizzetta or pork medallions. Excellent cheese plate SF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Nick's Cove
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 23240 Highway 1, Marshall, CA

properties.name: Nihon Whiskey Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1779 Folsom St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Nua
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 550 Green St, San Francisco, CAReview: http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/06/03/CMGHTPRECM1.DTL&type=food

properties.name: Oola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 860 Folsom St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Lounge styled restaurant is an understatement, down to the thumping music...but my interests stopped at the decor and ambiance, as the food was highly overpriced for comparable quality in the city, and the service was rude. Bottom line, hip joint, but too pricey for the food delivery.

properties.name: Palmetto
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2032 Union St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Pasta Moon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 315 Main St, Half Moon Bay, CAPasta Moon (650) 726-5125

properties.name: Pazzia
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 337 3rd St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Pescheria
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1708 Church St, San Francisco, CAReservations: (415) 647-3200 Casual coastal Italian cuisine in Noe Valley. Starting with the wine list, it consists of a fun unique selection of Italian, French, Spanish and Basque wines. Try the Txomin Extaniz Txakolina as a fantastic pairing with seafood. While the menu is actually small, absolutely everything is excellent. The arctic char on top of celery root puree covered with a poached egg is wonderful, and the butterfish sealed in parchment is an absolutely an inspiration in richness and warmth. I wasn\'t quite so fascinated with the desserts, I found the flavor balance a bit off compared to the main courses, and also a bit dry on the torte. The cannoli is probably the best choice here. Chronicle Review

properties.name: Philz Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  201 Berry St, San Francisco, CACoffee made with care, each cup made individually. You have to try with their special cream.

properties.name: Piccino Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  801 22nd Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Pier 39 - Ferry to Tiburon, Alcatraz
properties.description: Posted by FinksterPier 39 is a vast wasteland for tourists...however it is a great place to catch the ferries to Tiburon and do an Alcatraz tour for those interested. See http://www.blueandgoldfleet.com for ferry details. The Tiburon ferry gives you an awesome bay tour, goes past Alcatraz, and gets you to the ferry dock that takes you to Angel Island for a beatiful day hike if you\'re into that. Also see "Sam\'s Anchor Cafe" and "Guaymas" for food and drink choices in Tiburon.

properties.name: Pinxo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Rue d’Alger, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 40 20 72 00 Metro: Tuileries

properties.name: Piperade
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1015 Battery St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Fantastic traditional Basque food with flair, a nice change from the typical French cuisine in the city. Definitely have the Piperade with poached eggs and cured ham. The wine list carries wonderful Basque Txacolina wines.

properties.name: Pivovarsky Dum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Lipova 15 at Jecna, Praha 2 Tough to find a table at night, try during the day to make sure you can get in. A rare micro-brewery in Prague, while most restaurants are dominated by the amazingly good big brewery beers, Pivovarsky paves their own path and offers innovative twists as well as traditional style Czech beers. Try the green Nettle beer, quite a rare find. Food is good, try the Garlic Soup!

properties.name: Pizzetta 211
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 211 23rd Ave, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Platanos
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 598 Guerrero St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Excellent Cucina Latina...very creative and fresh food, not your typical latin american fair. Everything is amazing, and don\'t forget to try to the plantains! Great pitchers of Sangria, always a favorite.

properties.name: Plumed Horse
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 14555 Big Basin Way, Saratoga, CA, United States

properties.name: Pres a Vi
properties.description: Posted by Finkster One Letterman Drive, San Francisco, CA, United StatesPhone: (415) 409-3000 Reservations (OpenTable.com)Chronicle Review Global cuisine, East-West fusion in the Presidio.

properties.name: Presidio Social Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 563 Ruger St, San Francisco, CAPhone: (415) 885-1888 Casual eating in the old barracks of the Presidio.Chronicle Review

properties.name: Primo Patio Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  214 Townsend St, San Francisco, CAReservations: None needed...walk right in OK, favorite neighborhood place near the ballpark in South Beach. Best low-end food theory restaurant, you can\'t beat this place for the price, and you certainly can\'t beat their Caribbean food. They feature a very cute "middle of the block" patio that inset from the street. You\'ll miss this place if you don\'t look twice, it looks like a tiny little store front. You absolutely must try their Corn Cakes (amazing, never had anything like this), Jerk Chicken, and amazingly good fish dishes. I especially like their Ceviche and their fried Snapper Bits. White or red Sangria, and of course Red Stripe. If you\'re their for breakfast, try the Picadillo, another favorite.

properties.name: Quince
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1701 Octavia St, San Francisco,

properties.name: Repaire du Cartouche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 99 rue Amelot, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 47 00 25 86 Metro: Saint-Sebastien-Froissart

properties.name: Restaurant LuLu
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 816 Folsom Street, 94107Reservations (OpenTable.com)

properties.name: Restaurant Vincent
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Address: Grosse Pfarrgasse 7, 1020 Vienna, Austria Reservations: +43 1 214 15 16 Email: office@restaurant-vincent.at Simply one of the finest dining experience I have had and for the large group that attended this dinner. Fantastic continental viennese style fusion food on this Degustation menu, you can pick any number of courses between 4-10. While a more modern architectural design, the service was sparkling and absolutely made you feel at home...they simply made the meal absolutely fun, and the food phenomenal. Simply tell your server what food types you DON\'T like, and put yourself in their hands...trust me!

properties.name: Rex Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2323 Polk St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  1026 Valencia Street, San Francisco, CA, 94110

properties.name: Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1 Miramontes Point Rd, Half Moon Bay, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) OK...so I\'m not one to recommend hotels for food, but this new Ritz Carlton is a gem....visually stunning with views overlooking Half Moon Bay with waves crashing into the dramatic cliffs...and has THE BEST BRUNCH I\'ve ever tasted at the restaurant Navio. While pricey, it\'s an experience not to be missed. Also, the golf course is not to be missed for all you golfers.

properties.name: Rose Pistola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 532 Columbus Avenue, San Francisco, CA, 94133Reservations (OpenTable.com) Super Italian food, not your typical North Beach place. Amazing wood fired pizza crust and very well prepared meat dishes. One of the city\'s most famous restaurants now.

properties.name: Rubicon
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 558 Sacramento St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Excellent California cuisine with a side of Italian....a De Niro-Coppola joint venture restaurant. Pricey, but worth a vist!

properties.name: SF MOMA
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  151 Third Street San Francisco, CA 94103The Museum of Modern Art houses fantastic collections of sculpture, painting, photography, architecture and design, and media arts. The MOMA building itself is a fascinating architectural design example and is well worth the visit.

properties.name: Sam's Anchor Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  27 Main St, Tiburon, CAReservations for dinner only by calling (415) 435-4527, walk-ins with a short wait typically on the outdoor deck for brunch/lunch/drinks. Great weekend outdoor restaurant on a deck overlooking Tiburon and San Francisco Bay. Best place in the bay area to get drinks on a hot afternoon. Right next to the Ferry Docks, make sure to take the Ferry from Pier 39, it\'s a beatiful trip over.

properties.name: Sea Salt
properties.description: Posted by Finkster2512 San Pablo Ave, Berkeley, CA

properties.name: Sens
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4 Embarcadero Ctr, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Serpentine
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2495 3rd St., San FranciscoFrom the team that started Slow Club....

properties.name: Shampers
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4 Kingly St, London, W1B 5PE, UKGreat little french bistro and wine bar. Ask for SImon the owner, a wonderfully kind gentleman who will give you fantastic recommendations for food and wine. Very inexpensive versus other London offerings.

properties.name: Slanted Door
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Reservations only by phone at (415) 861-8032 In the Ferry Plaza Building: 1 Ferry Building San Francisco, CA 94111 Incredibly innovative and flavorful Vietnamese fusion restaurant. Incredible Clay Pot dishes. Very difficult to get a table, recommend calling far ahead for reservations, or simply walking in during lunch to sit at the bar. If you are just wanting take away food, few know about "Out the Door", inside the main ferry plaza, where they have redefined fast food - the quality of Slanted Door and some of their best dishes, cheap and fast! Check out the Belgian beers and German Rieslings for a great food pairing. My favorites include the Imperial Rolls, Grapefruit Jicama Salad, Catfish Claypot, Cellophane Noodles, Chinese Broccoli or Green Bean side dishes.

properties.name: Slow Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2501 Mariposa St, San Francisco, CA, 94110Reservations: by calling 415-241-9390 Using specialty organic produce.

properties.name: Sotto La Mole Ristorante
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 9, Via Montebello, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 8179398 Closed Mercoledi Slow food eating guide recommendation

properties.name: South Food+Winebar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 330 Townsend, San Francisco, CAKiwis and Aussies oh my! An Australian & New Zealand food and wine focused joint....definitely a swank small small neighborhood vibe. Right across from the train station (and downstairs from my place, even better!)

properties.name: Spruce
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3640 Sacramento, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Sugar Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Finkster377 Hayes St, San Francisco, CA 94102415-255-7144 Ultra-chill lounge in Hayes-Valley. Sweets and savory snacks as well.

properties.name: Sui Tofu
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2777 El Camino, Santa Clara, CAHome style Korean food

properties.name: Suppenkuche
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 525 Laguna Street, San Francisco, CAWhile I\'ve never much been able to find fun and good quality german cuisine (even in Germany), it has certainly found a home in Hayes Valley. Fun, fun, fun...this place is warm and inviting, with a lot of communal seating which makes it very social, making it a great eating and drinking hall. Most importantly, they are home to the best German beer menu I\'ve seen stateside, and most on tap as well which is rare. The food is surprisingly good quality, making an incredibly light schnitzel, as well as a wonderful buttery and light spaezle. The black forest cake is also quite good.

properties.name: Swan Oyster Depot
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1517 Polk St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Table de Fes
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 5 rue Sainte-Beuve, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 45 48 29 94 Metro: Notre-Dame-des-Champs, or Vavin

properties.name: Terzo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3011 Steiner Street, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Awesome tapas style food from the chef from Rose Pistola. Fun environment.

properties.name: The Fifth Floor
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 12 4th St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com)

properties.name: The Last Supper Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1199 Valencia St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Great southern Italian comfort food in a warm family style environment serving mid-size groups on long tables. Lots of great fall flavors, butternut squash, homemade pasta dishes.

properties.name: The Last Supper Club
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1199 Valencia St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Very cozy southern Italian comfort food. Wonderful ambience.

properties.name: The Orbit Room
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1900 Market St, San Francisco, CAReview Cafe by day, gray bar by night. Show up early to this tiny place, especially to try the fresh ingredients in their drinks.

properties.name: The Phone Booth
properties.description: Posted by Finkster1398 S Van Ness Ave, San Francisco, CAReview A "gray" bar in The City. Got to love the jukebox filled with indie rock albums.

properties.name: The Salt House
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 545 Mission St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) Named after a famous pub in the UK, the folks from Town Hall have certainly upscaled the pub with Town hall. Housed in wonderfully restored old publishing house featuring the original brick, wood floors and metal and wood beams, it\'s a warm and inviting environment. The food is a great mix of casual style French and California cuisine...you must start with the Canadian styled Poutine which is potato wedges fried and covered with fontina and an rich beef gravy. Also had a wonderful Monk fish with Chard and braised Ox sauce, amazing Winter Squash soup with sage oil, and Pork Belly with Poached Egg on a mixed salad...overall each dish was very well balanced and creative "warm" flavors you won\'t typically find at restaurants in San Francisco. Very creative wine list, we had the Royal Tokaji from Hungary, a nice change. Most recent trip, I went the shellfish route, SH has an excellent selection of very fresh oysters. Also had the baked oysters which were good, but not great. Started with a white bean soup topped with pesto which was wonderful and very well balanced. The dungeness crab salad has an amazingly fresh appeal and is drenched in a great olive oil dressing. The foie gras torchon was quite good quality and matched with an excellent apricot reduction. Service was extraordinary, rare for a new restaurant to be this well tuned. Very catering as well to my young daughter who joined, made us feel at home.

properties.name: The Tech Museum of Innovation
properties.description: Posted by Finkster  201 South Market Street, San Jose, caWhile many other museums are about core sciences and discovery, The Tech, placed in the heart of Silicon Valley, embodies technology integration at its finest. The Tech houses hundreds of technology innovations of the computer era and beyond and makes a fascinating trip for visitors young and old.

properties.name: The Village Pub
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 2967 Woodside Rd, Woodside, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) OK, so this is hardly a pub, but it is really a charming high end French and California cuisine twist on pub food with a great wine list. An excellent find in the hills of Woodside. A nice stop off after wine tasting in the Santa Cruz mountains.

properties.name: Three Seasons
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3317 Steiner St, San Francisco, CA(415) 567-9989

properties.name: Ti Couz Creperie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 3108 16th St, San Francisco, CA 94103Being a savory crepes lover, I love going here for dinner. Certainly not your sidewalk crepes joint, Ti Couz has reinvented the crepe, spicing it up with many unique offerings. You have to love the mexican gourd jellyfish lamps, reminds me of Playa del Carmen.

properties.name: Town Hall
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 342 Howard St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) One of my favorite California cuisine restaurants...great mix of food, with really interesting flavor pairings you\'d never expect. The chef mixes in a bit of creole and soul food with excellent prepared meat and fish dishes. A couple of my favorite dishes are: * Barbequed Shrimp, Worstershire and parsely garlic sauce (starter) * Sweet onion and blue cheese fondue with fingerling potatoes, asparagus and cauliflower (starter) * Faith\'s warm Smithfield ham and cheese toast with poached egg and jalapeno cream (starter) * Sauteed day boat scallops with smoked andouille sausage jambalaya, basmati rice and crab butter * Slow-roasted duck with toasted wild rice, pecans, spiced dates and gingersnap gravy Great wine bar as well. Some great choices: * Rose, Jean-Luc Colombo, "Côte Bleue", Côte-du-Rhône, Rhône, France, 04 * Tempranillo, Rioja, 2002 (this was one of my favorite wines)

properties.name: Trattoria Valenza
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 39, Via Borgo Dora, Torino, ItalyTel: +39 011 5213914 Closed Domenica, Lunedi a pranzo Slow food eating guide recommendation.

properties.name: Tres Agaves
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 130 Townsend St, San Francisco, CAReservations (OpenTable.com) First true Tequila bar in the City. Try the Reposado Tequila Flights. Great deal, and you\'ll get to try all sorts of Tequilas you\'ve never had. And yes....Tequila is a sipping drink. Food is "just OK" not great for the price. Very fresh ingredients, just not that inventive.

properties.name: Tsunami
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1306 Fulton, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Tynska Literarni Kavarna
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Tynska 6 right off of Old Town Square behind "Cinderella\'s Castle" Tyn church. OK, good luck finding this place, but if you do! Seriously though, when you\'re in the square, immediately on the left (north) side of the church, you\'ll find Tynska street under one of the archways. About 100 yards up Tynska (you\'ll go through a very small square first), you\'ll find an incredibly hidden door at Tynska 6, housing the best Bohemian cafe in a little cavern right behind the church. Better yet, beer is about 23 Koruna or . You\'ll find all sorts of interesting people and students in this "literary cavern".

properties.name: U Cerneho Vola
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Loreténske Néměsté 1 (just up the walking street from the castle) For being so close to the castle, you\'ll never find a cheaper Kozel Dark, nor will you often find Kozel Light on tap often. Very old, communal tables, reeks of local hangout...bottom line a great place. Some food available, but this is just a a great pub to hang out in.

properties.name: U Fleku
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Kremencova 11, 5 minute walk from Wenceslas Square. U Fleku is a large pub restaurant brewery serving the famous U Fleku dark beer ONLY since 1499. You heard right, dark beer brewed onsite, and that\'s it. Believe me you won\'t be dissapointed as this should be included in the top dark beers in the Czech republic. and micro-brewery all rolled into one. Of all the traditional Czech pubs in Prague, architecturally there is no finer example. U Fleku is located in an ancient building dating from 1499. This large, sprawling tavern is a complex of rooms laid out in true European beerhall style. U Fleku is a great but over touristed place to enjoy traditional Czech food, beer and entertainment.

properties.name: U Vodarny
properties.description: Posted by Finkster75 Korunni at Nitranska, Prague 3 As part of my beer tour of Prague, this is at the top of the list. "At the Water Tower" is famous for another liquid: fresh Gambrinus, Pilsner Urquell and Kozel from tanks rather than barrels – pubs must consume a certain amount of beer to be given this honour. It is also famous for excellent and cheap home cooked traditional food and that superb habit of singing rock n roll and country and western songs in Czech. Plus they have an adjacent non-stop herna with saloon doors. You absolutely have not had Kozel Dark until you have had it on tankard, it is exquisite, there is a big difference in the freshness versus just on tap or the bottle.

properties.name: Vino Rosso
properties.description: Posted by Finkster629 Cortland St, San Francisco, CASF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Wadja
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 10, Rue de la Grande-Chaumière, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 46 33 02 02 Metro: Vavin

properties.name: Westfield San Francisco Centre
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 855 Market St, San Francisco, CAThe San Francisco Centre near Union Square is the shopping Mecca of San Francisco with the newly opened Emporium building being added to the center. The center includes the latest new high end fashion boutiques and a brand new Bloomingdale\'s and Nordstrom. Don\'t forget to visit the food center downstairs to find unique culinary fair, and go to the top of the Emporium building to see the all glass rotunda.

properties.name: Willi's Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 13, rue des Petits-Champs, Paris, FranceReservations: +33 01 42 61 05 09 Needed for dinner, lunch walk-ins allowed Metro: Pyramides Excellent wine by the bottle selection with a reasonable by the glass wine list. Willi\'s Wine Bar, while their name does not suggest it, is also a fantastic restaurant, specializing in classic country style French cooking. Excellent meat, Foie Gras, vegetable dishes and stews. One of the best no frills Parisian restaurants in my opinion, steering away from heavy or innovative sauces or preparation techniques, just classic preparation with wonderful natural flavors being brought to the surface. Make sure to take a walk through the Jardin du Palais Royal, it\'s a must see on a warm sunny day.

properties.name: Wink
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 1014 North Lamar, Austin, TX, 78703Wink to me is the best restaurant in Austin, delivering extraordinary quality French influenced cuisine using locally farmed ingredients. You can always count on a great Foie Gras dish, as well as wonderful chic comfort food. The wine selection is fantastic and carries over into the great Wink Wine Bar next door that also carries the same menu as the full restaurant. If you\'re looking for a casual but sexy wine bar experience, it\'s the place to go.

properties.name: Wirtshaus in der au
properties.description: Posted by Finkster Lilienstrasse 51, Munich, GermanyKnown as one of the best traditional Bavarian restaurants in Munich, they stake the claim to the best Wiener Schnitzel in town and I can\'t argue with them. Great atmosphere, great beer.

properties.name: Yield
properties.description: Posted by Finkster2490 3rd St, San Francisco, CADogpatch neighborhood winebar focusing on "green" wines (organic) with flatbreads and cheeses and other small plates: Small Plates — Rosemary Toasted Almonds; Orange & Fennel Marinated Olives Cheese Plate — Choice of one of four cheeses (served with artisanal bread & crackers) Large Plates — Sardines with Butter Crostini; Prosciutto, Fig & Arugula Salad Organic Flatbreads — Four-Cheese Flatbread Pizza; Vegetarian Flatbread Pizza Sweets — Chocolate Plate SF Gate Wine Bars #1 SF Gate Wine Bars #2

properties.name: Ze Kitchen Galerie
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 4, rue des Grands-Augustins, Paris, FranceTel: +33 01 44 32 00 32 Metro: Saint-Michel

properties.name: Zibibbo
properties.description: Posted by Finkster 430 Kipling St, Palo Alto, CA

properties.name: Zé da Calçada
properties.description: Posted by Finkster R. 31 de Janeiro, Amarante, 4600 PortugalQuaint riverside location in the historic town of Amarante in the Vinho Verde region. Very local Portugese food!

properties.name: de Young Museum
properties.description: Posted by Finkster    50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Drive, San Francisco, CAThe new de Young museum has been completely re-built and is a must see building in city, particularly the view from the top of the cube. The museum houses an excellent permanent modern art collection. Check the website for current special exhibits.
